      • blockingSubmit

        public void blockingSubmit(java.lang.Runnable task)
        This will attempt to submit the task to the pool and, in the case where the queue is full, block until space is available
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the executor is shutting down or terminated

      • submit

        public <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> submit(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> task)
        Specified by:
        submit in interface java.util.concurrent.ExecutorService
        Overrides:
        submit in class java.util.concurrent.AbstractExecutorService

      • blockingSubmit

        public <T> java.util.concurrent.Future<T> blockingSubmit(java.util.concurrent.Callable<T> task)
        This will attempt to submit the task to the pool and, in the case where the queue is full, block until space is available
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the executor is shutting down or terminated

      • resizeThreadPool

        public void resizeThreadPool(int newPoolSize)
        This will set both the core and max pool size and kill any excess threads as their tasks complete.

      • pause

        public boolean pause()
        If possible, pauses the executor so that active threads will complete their current task and then wait to execute new tasks from the queue until unpaused.
        Returns:
        true if the state of the executor was changed from running to paused, false if already paused
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the executor is shutting down or terminated

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Indicates whether this thread pool is currently paused. Note that even when paused, active jobs may still be completing, but no new jobs will be started.

      • resume

        public boolean resume()
        If possible, resumes the executor so that tasks will continue to be executed from the queue.
        Returns:
        true if the state of the executor was changed from paused to running, false if already running
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the executor is shutting down or terminated
        See Also:
        pause()

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Enhancement to shutdown() that effectively stops any new tasks from executing while allowing running tasks to complete. This also correctly handles the case of stopping from a paused state.

      • getActiveCount

        public int getActiveCount()
        Overrides:
        getActiveCount in class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor

      • getUnfinishedTasks

        public long getUnfinishedTasks()

      • isShutdownWhenIdle

        public boolean isShutdownWhenIdle()

      • setShutdownWhenIdle

        public void setShutdownWhenIdle(boolean shutdownWhenIdle)
        When true, the next time this executor is idle (the task queue is empty and there are no active tasks), it will shut itself down.

        NOTE: only set this to true if you are sure the pool will not go idle until all tasks have been submitted.
